definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: The stubborn Bull will have difficulties understanding the unpredictable side of you.
sentences.chinese: 变幻莫测的你很难被固执的牛儿理解。

sentences.english: Still, these are tense and unpredictable times in trade relations between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这都是两国间贸易紧张且变幻莫测的时期。

sentences.english: He is a vaporous and shifting mirage.
sentences.chinese: 他像是一团雾，漂移不定，变幻莫测。

sentences.english: Where all of the walls all continually change.
sentences.chinese: 所有的宫墙都变幻莫测。

sentences.english: Magician means a changeable stage full of masters.
sentences.chinese: 其意为变幻莫测，高手云集的舞台。

sentences.english: The mystic clouds drift in and out, changing the scenery from minute to minute.
sentences.chinese: 神奇的云海漂进漂出，风景时时刻刻变幻莫测。

sentences.english: Pandemics, like the viruses that cause them, are unpredictable.
sentences.chinese: 同造成大流行的病毒一样，大流行变幻莫测。

sentences.english: As I said, pandemics are unpredictable and prone to deliver surprises.
sentences.chinese: 如我所说，大流行是变幻莫测的，往往令人猝不及防。

sentences.english: Weather patterns are changing, and storms seem more violent.
sentences.chinese: 天气模式变幻莫测，暴风暴雨愈加猛烈。

sentences.english: The optimal state of mind can be fleeting, maddeningly elusive.
sentences.chinese: 最佳心理状态可以是短暂的，变幻莫测的。

sentences.english: Time, such as smoke, unpredictable, wonderful subtle.
sentences.chinese: 时如烟云，变幻莫测，奇妙含蓄。

sentences.english: Life changes there every day, so do the seasons.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦的生活日日翻新，正如它的天气般变幻莫测。

sentences.english: It was a vast and treacherous landscape, but breath-takingly beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 这是一片广阔而变幻莫测的景致，但却美得令人惊讶。

sentences.english: Clouds are impermanent, but the sky is stable.
sentences.chinese: 云变幻莫测，天空却是一成不变。

sentences.english: Politics is rather a catch-as-catch-can business.
sentences.chinese: 政治是一种相当变幻莫测的事务。

sentences.english: Weather conditions can change quickly, making preflight briefings obsolete.
sentences.chinese: 天气状况变幻莫测，使得飞行前的天气信息失去时效。

definition: in an instant a myriad changes (idiom); rapid substantial change
to drift without a resting place (idiom)/roving/errant/vagrant/erratic
variable/changeable/fickle/impermanence (Sanskrit: anitya)/ghost taking away the soul after death/to pass away/to die
brilliant and varied/(often in the combination 精彩纷呈)
